1479134150393217034.text: We all must come together: Democrats, Republicans, Independents & recommit to the fight of the civil rights giants who came before, including my friend John Lewis, working harder than ever to protect the right to vote. Our democracy & country depend on it. https://t.co/SGl3QsfE1V

1479134148350590987.text: But in that moment, I felt a strong determination to not let the insurrectionists win and to not let them stop our democratic process and erase the will of the American people. And we did so that night. A strong bipartisan vote certifying the results.

1479134146626834435.text: Nearly everyone in that room, Republicans and Democrats alike, were shocked. I saw the looks on some of my colleagues' faces who now say the 6th wasn’t dangerous, wasn’t an insurrection. They are not telling the truth. I was with them, I saw and heard their shock and horror too.

1479134144714186752.text: I did multiple interviews from that room, including the @dallasnews article above. The rioters were still in the Capitol, but I was determined to go back to the floor as soon as possible to certify the election. You can see me here with @RepPeteAguilar and @RepJeffries. https://t.co/6tIMdtivlI

1479134140226318340.text: In the secured room I still did not feel we were safe, so I took apart a stanchion and prepared to use it to defend the room if it too came under attack. https://t.co/oMejqiUcuv

1479134136224952330.text: As we evacuated, I saw the Parliamentarians carrying some of the priceless heirlooms from the Speaker’s rostrum, the oldest things the House still has dating back to our earliest days. I asked why, and he said to make sure they weren’t lost to history.

1479134133997776897.text: Eventually the call came to evacuate. As I left I turned & saw glass flying from the main door as rioters tried to break in. The officers stayed behind, guns drawn & pointed. They saved my life. I would not have met my son Cameron if not for their bravery. https://t.co/cYN102ngna

1479134131141369857.text: We could hear banging on the doors that the President walks through to give the State of the Union. The doors were barricaded with furniture usually used to hold legislative papers. The officers in the chamber pulled their guns and told us to stay away from the doors.

1479134128721342465.text: I texted my pregnant wife at home with our two year-old, “Whatever happens, I love you.” The ornamental doors were closed and locked. Alarms started blaring. I will never forget that alarm sound. In my mind, I was preparing to make a last stand. https://t.co/SCYQEJQORY

1479134126364053515.text: I took off my suit jacket and prepared to fight. Several of my colleagues joined me in taking off their jackets. You can see me helping @RepJeffries with his mask here. https://t.co/O2JVYv58r8

1479134120127123463.text: We again tried to continue the debate, now with @RepMcGovern presiding. But soon thereafter, the proceedings were again interrupted and we were told that the mob had breached the Capitol, that tear gas had been deployed in the rotunda, and to grab the gas masks under our seats.

1479134118524903426.text: An announcement was made that the Capitol was under attack, but that we were safe and should continue the proceedings. Soon thereafter, security personnel swept into the Chamber and grabbed our top leadership and hurried them out.

1479134116662681605.text: During the debate, I began receiving alarmed texts from friends, family and staff asking where I was. I responded that I was on the House floor, which to me meant that I was in one of the safest places in the world.

1479134114569723906.text: As the results for Alabama and Alaska were certified and accepted, I braced to see what would happen when Arizona was called. Paul Gosar rose to object. His objection was seconded by Ted Cruz and many on the Republican side cheered. I felt something very dark was beginning.

1479134112942333954.text: As a member of the Democratic leadership team, I took my place on the House floor near @RepCheri, @RepBarbaraLee, @RepJeffries, @RepSeanMaloney, @RepPeteAguilar and @RepMondaire. The Vice President and the Senate entered the House for the Joint Session to begin.

1479134110388035587.text: When I got into the office I saw a New Year’s card from @RepCicilline on my desk with a quote from John Lewis. I took a picture of it to remind myself to stay hopeful throughout the day. Mr. Lewis would have been proud of his state’s election the night before. https://t.co/0cfFJjlx2V

1479134106311143437.text: A year ago I woke up early, anxious and excited for a long but historic day. I was encouraged by the election in Georgia the night before, w/ the first Jewish and Black Senator ever elected to represent the state, and I was ready to certify the results of a historic election. ⬇️

The John Lewis VRA would restore that by creating a new modern preclearance formula, working to end voter discrimination.

1455925021721993216.text: Today the Senate will consider the John Lewis Voting Rights Act, critical legislation to restore key provisions of the Voting Rights Act of 1965, safeguarding our democracy and protecting everyone's right to vote. 1369733219747258376.text: This bill will put our region and our country on track to defeat this horrible virus, reopen schools, get people back to work and rebuild our economy. I was proud to vote for it today and will never stop working to make sure North Texas has the resources we need to recover.

1369733218539298827.text: 7️⃣ The American Rescue Plan includes nearly $130 billion to give K-12 schools the resources they need to reopen safely. These funds will help repair ventilation systems, purchase PPE, and implement social distancing guidelines, with 20% dedicated to address loss of learning.

1369733217390067715.text: 6️⃣ This package also addresses the disparities in access to health care that this pandemic has laid bare. It adds incentives for states like Texas that have failed to expand Medicaid and makes coverage affordable for middle class families who were previously priced out.

1369733216396079107.text: 5️⃣ The most important thing we can do for our economy and our families is to increase vaccine distribution. The American Rescue Plan will create a national plan, including community vaccine centers and aid for state and local governments to help support their operations.

1369733215053840385.text: 4️⃣ Aviation is a key component of our economy here in North Texas. This bill will continue to provide stability for airline workers by adding an additional $15 billion to the Payroll Support Program. It also includes funding to support @DFWAirport and @DallasLoveField.

1369733210985349120.text: 3️⃣ The American Rescue Plan ensures our hardest hit businesses have the resources they need to weather this crisis and recover by establishing a Restaurant Revitalization Fund and giving PPP priority to our smallest businesses.

1369733206283550732.text: 2️⃣ It expands the Child Tax Credit by $1,000 dollars for kids over 6 & $1,600 for kids under 6. This could lift 500,000 Texas kids out of poverty.

1369733202374496257.text: 1️⃣ This bill includes additional direct payments of up to $1,400 per adult & kid, so a family of four could get up to $5,600.

1369733200218619906.text: Today, I voted for the #AmericanRescuePlan to deliver much needed relief to North Texans. This bill has a lot of important provisions, so I wanted to break down what this means for families, workers, and small businesses across our region.

1369664340354359299.text: Reminder: I am hosting a town hall tomorrow at 6:30 pm on the resources available to help you recover from the winter storm in February. I will be joined by representatives from @FEMA, the @SBAgov, and @TexasTDI.  RSVP here: https://t.co/VZEMhoGc2q https://t.co/U8GgrHKGMk

1363285175598256130.text: I’ll keep working to get answers and clarity on what happened as well as to fight for federal resources to help North Texas recover from this disaster.

1363285173937258497.text: We knew this storm was coming well enough in advance to take commonsense actions, like the ones Vistra did, to salvage as much power as possible.

1363285172192505858.text: While this weather, and perhaps rolling blackouts, was not preventable, the response by our state leaders did not meet the severity of the moment and lives were cut short because of it.

1363285170456064000.text: By their account, no one seemed to react with the haste and urgency they believed necessary, and they emphasized that ERCOT’s projections of the power supply were far below the demand they were seeing.

1363285168715403264.text: They alerted ERCOT immediately, as well as the Texas Railroad Commission and other state government officials.

1363285167029309440.text: They told me their team began to sound alarms on February 9th when their meteorologist saw freezing temperatures in the forecast knowing Texas’ infrastructure was not built for much less than 10 degrees.

1363285165712281600.text: They also shared some of the commonsense, temporary actions they took to prepare for the storm that allowed their energy production units to perform much better than the companies who didn’t.

1363285164709842945.text: This morning I spoke with the CEO of Vistra Energy, a North Texas based energy company, who shared a very troubling account of our state’s and ERCOT’s response leading up to this week’s storm.

1362144350956879874.text: Today, North Texans are still facing snow, sleet, and cold temperatures. ERCOT is continuing to work to reduce its shed and restore power to more North Texans. 1361819878378901507.text: I will continue to work across all levels of government to make sure North Texas has the resources we need to weather this crisis and to make sure that North Texans are aware of and able to access them.

1361819877372268549.text: ERCOT is reporting scams circulating on social media asking for Texans to text their personal account numbers. ERCOT does not need any of your personal information to restore your power, please do not text these scammers.

1361819875786784771.text: As another bitter cold night begins, there are warming centers open throughout North Texas. You can find a full list here: https://t.co/ElhtNMV4cK. The @TexasGuard is working to transport Texans to warming centers when necessary. You can also dial 2-1-1 to find centers near you.

1361819874788573186.text: Right now, FEMA is providing generators, blankets, and water to save lives while this storm persists. The most important role FEMA will play in this effort will be to make sure resources are available to help us recover from the widespread damage.

1361819873781944321.text: Today, I spoke with @fema officials and got an update on their efforts in North Texas. They emphasized the need to share information about available resources. I will continue to update my pages with resources available to keep folks safe and warm and encourage you to share them.

Congress must stand on the side of the people and #ProtectOurCare.

Today, we’ll vote on my resolution calling on the Trump Administration to stop backing a lawsuit that threatens Americans’ health care and protections for those with pre-existing conditions.

1113185630153060352.text:
On #EqualPayDay we must ensure everyone receives equal pay for equal work. Women earn 80 cents for every dollar men earn. And for women of color, the gap is much wider. 

Proud to have voted for the Paycheck Fairness Act which passed the House last week. https://t.co/U2akLitWzu

1111741531298426880.text: This Congress will not allow people with pre-existing conditions to go back to the days where they could be thrown off their health care just because they got sick.

1111741530665046017.text: Americans are facing higher health costs than ever, but this lawsuit would drive up prices and put coverage out of reach for thousands of Texas families.

1111741529826172928.text: I came to Washington to get things done, and I’ll work w/ anyone to lower costs and defend protections for those with pre-existing conditions.
